x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.potential_impact: Prevent kids from missing out on the proven cognitive, social, and emotional benefits of learning music, which are crucial for academic success and healthy development.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Access to musical lessons and instruments is often expensive, creating a significant financial barrier for children and teens in lower-income neighborhoods.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

Band Together the ServiceNow app to manage and scale a free community music program specifically for children and teens. It will provide workflows for scheduling, logistics, and inventory control.

  1. Lesson and Event Management: Portal for parents/guardians to easily browse lessons filtered by age group, skill level, instrument, and location.
  2. Instrument Loaner Program: Loaner Check-In/Check-Out system ensures every registered child or teen has an instrument (such as a guitar, ukulele, or keyboard) for the duration of the group lesson.
  3. Voluteneer Tracking: Tracking musicians and instructments that they are able to teach. Lesson availability and skill level. 

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Service Portal/Employee Center
  • Walk-Up Experience 
  • Flow Designer
  • Asset Management
  • Catalog Items
  • Custom Tables
  • Record Prodcuers
  • Performance Analytics

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Efficient and streamlined Check-in/Check-Out processes
  • Background checks for adult volunteers
  • Reminder system for lessons to students
